status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"87kqn","text":"Stable cell lines generated using lentivirus exhibit long term protein expression and the system is highly reproducible. In this protocol, we describe the use of the 3rd generation lentiviral system which uses three different plasmids for generating stable cell lines. First plasmid contains your gene of interest usually flanked by Long Terminal Repeat (LTR) sequences, that are integrated into the host genome. Second is the pCMV Delta R8.2 plasmid that encodes all components necessary for packaging the lentivirus viz. HIV-1 Gag, Pol, Tat and Rev. Third and the final plasmid is the pCMV VSVG that encodes the viral envelope protein.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":17}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B068C610DA8711ED9F7F4395F9DA6508","url":"https://www.creative-biogene.com/support/protocol-for-generating-stably-expressed-mammalian-cell-lines-using-lentivirus.html"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ohiv","text":"1. Cell culture incubators (37 °C, 5% CO2and 32 °C, 5% CO2)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":40,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":57,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cr3m","text":"2. Hemocytometer (Standard)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crgff","text":"3. Laminar hood BSL-2 type","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1epni","text":"4. 37 °C water bath","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7l0o","text":"5. Autoclave","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ruav","text":"6. Micropipettes (1,000 μl, 200 μl)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7788p","text":"7. -80 °C freezer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7in3f","text":"A. Preparation of lentivirus in HEK293T cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t1fu","text":"1. Day 0: Seed about 2-3 million HEK293T cells in a 10 cm2plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":57,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c31g5","text":"2. Day 1: HEK293T cells should be about 70-80% confluent. If for some reason they seem less you may wait for another 8-10 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3v7o","text":"3. Prepare transfection mix using the following proportions in a sterile 1.5 ml Eppendorf tube as per manufacturer's instructions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
